articles.content: It’s really happening for Tesla in China, with company boss Elon Musk breaking ground at a new manufacturing plant in Shanghai on Monday, January 7 its first such facility outside of the U.S. The company’s third so-called “Gigafactory” will assemble Tesla’s m… [+2376 chars]

articles.author: Jessica Resnick-Ault
articles.title: U.S. oil prices edge up on trade talk hopes, OPEC cuts - Reuters
articles.description: Oil prices rose more than 2 percent on Tuesday, supported by hopes that crude demand may rise more quickly if talks between U.S. and Chinese officials resolve the trade dispute between the world's two biggest economies.
articles.content: NEW YORK (Reuters) - Oil prices rose more than 2 percent on Tuesday, supported by hopes that crude demand may rise more quickly if talks between U.S. and Chinese officials resolve the trade dispute between the world’s two biggest economies. U.S. West Texas In… [+2474 chars]

articles.title: "The washrooms at Morgan Stanley are exceptional. They're like a 5* hotel" - eFinancialCareers
articles.description: Morgan Stanley has got something special in store for its London employees in 2019.
articles.content: If you're looking for a new job in London for the New Year and aesthetics are high on your list of priorities, you might want to try Morgan Stanley. We hear that the U.S. bank's London offices are really rather special. "Morgan Stanley's office in Canary Whar… [+3291 chars]

articles.author: Ian King, business presenter
articles.title: Serious business of cancer sparks Pharma M&A spree - Sky News
articles.description: Research and development for cancer treatments is notoriously expensive, so it pays manufacturers to have real scale in the field.
articles.content: 2019 is only a week old but, in the pharmaceutical sector, there have already been two big deals. Eli Lilly, the US drugs giant famous for creating the anti-depressant Prozac, today announced it was buying Loxo Oncology, a company that is barely five years ol… [+4744 chars]

articles.title: AstraZeneca hires controversial head of cancer R&D - Financial Times
articles.description: Drugmaker ‘doubles down’ on cancer treatments and appoints José Baselga to oversee unit
articles.content: AstraZeneca has appointed José Baselga, a controversial cancer expert, to run its oncology research and development operations as part of a wider shake-up by the UK-listed drugmaker to double down on the area. Mr Baselga was the physician-in-chief at Memorial… [+2681 chars]

articles.title: Supermarkets battle over New Year price cuts - BBC News
articles.description: Morrisons and Tesco join other leading UK supermarkets in cutting prices.
articles.content: Image copyright Steve Dresser The UK's biggest supermarkets have launched a range of price cuts. On Monday, Morrisons said it would cut prices by an average of 20% on 935 products, including tinned tomatoes, cereals and multivitamins. Also on Monday, Tesco, w… [+2511 chars]
